intro: Borreria tenella var. lavandulifolia, commonly known as lavenderleaf borreria, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its aromatic, lavender-colored flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or disturbed soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are often fragrant and have a distinct, minty scent, which contributes to its common name. It is used in traditional medicine and as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and pleasant aroma.
